Package it.polimi.ingsw.connection.utility

Class TimeoutCounter

java.lang.Object
java.util.TimerTask
it.polimi.ingsw.connection.utility.TimeoutCounter
All Implemented Interfaces:
PingObserver, java.lang.Runnable
public class TimeoutCounter
extends java.util.TimerTask
implements PingObserver
Timeout(s) counter class to check if a certain amount of time is elapsed and then to trigger a specified task.
Author:
AndreaAltomare

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    TimeoutCounter​(int maxRetriesNumber, TimeExpiredInterface timeExpired)
    To work with this class it's necessary to provide the maximum number of Timeouts (retries) beyond which the [Time Expired] task is being triggered.

  • Constructor Details

    • TimeoutCounter

      public TimeoutCounter​(int maxRetriesNumber, TimeExpiredInterface timeExpired)
      To work with this class it's necessary to provide the maximum number of Timeouts (retries) beyond which the [Time Expired] task is being triggered.
      Parameters:
      maxRetriesNumber - (Maximum number of Timeouts)
      timeExpired - (TimeExpiredInterface functional interface object-instance)

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Run() method for TimeoutCounter class. It defines the task executed when a time period of a Timer elapses.
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable
      Specified by:
      run in class java.util.TimerTask

    • check

      private boolean check​(int i)
      Check if the number of timeouts has exceeded the threshold.
      Parameters:
      i - (Number of timeouts)
      Returns:
      (Threshold exceeded ? true : false)

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Reset timeout counter.

    • update

      public void update​(PingResponse m)
      When a Ping response is received, update the state by setting responseReceived to true.
